transportAdvice: Mahón's compact old town and harbour area are very walkable, but exploring the wider island requires a car or the limited regional bus network, which connects main towns seasonally. Taxis are available but relatively scarce outside the city centre, so renting a vehicle is strongly recommended for reaching beaches and rural areas.

weather.description: Cool and quiet winter month with occasional rain and strong tramuntana winds; most tourist facilities are closed.
Still cool with unpredictable weather, though sunny spells are common and the island is very uncrowded.
Temperatures begin to rise and almond blossoms appear, but rain and wind remain possible throughout the month.
Pleasant spring weather with mild temperatures and longer days; a good time for hiking and sightseeing before crowds arrive.
Warm and increasingly sunny with comfortable conditions ideal for outdoor activities and early beach visits.
Early summer brings reliably warm and sunny weather; beaches are open and the island begins to fill with visitors.
Peak summer with hot, dry, and sunny days; beaches are busy and the sea is warm and inviting.
The hottest and most crowded month; expect full beaches, high humidity, and lively evening atmosphere in Mahón.
Warm and still very pleasant with slightly fewer crowds; sea temperatures remain high and conditions are excellent.
Autumn brings cooler temperatures and occasional rain, but many sunny days remain and the island quietens considerably.
Noticeably cooler and wetter with most tourist businesses winding down; a peaceful time for nature walks.
Cool winter conditions with short days and a chance of rain; the island is very quiet and authentic in character.
